title: Designing Blended Learning Environments in Business Administration: Flipped Learning-Based Socio-Organizational Approach Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic business administration theories, understanding of fundamental instructional design principles, and foundational awareness of interpersonal relationships and communication within organizations. Additionally, basic recognition of social institutions and cultural contexts
context.additional_context: Practical instructional design competency enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers, simultaneously considering learners' social interaction skills and leadership development within organizations. Particularly emphasizes educational design reflecting civic rights and responsibilities in multicultural environments and economic decision-making processes.

learning_goals: Propose a socio-organizational design framework (learning culture development, role-sharing system, feedback mechanism) for applying a flipped learning-based blended learning model to business administration education, incorporating strategies to enhance organizational citizenship and collaborative competencies.

Learners design a strategy linking online pre-learning materials (videos, readings) and offline activities (discussions, projects, case analyses) in a 3:1 ratio during the mid-graduate course (2â€“4 weeks) and develop an implementation plan meeting at least four of five learning objective-based assessment checklist items (goal achievement, collaboration efficiency, creativity, practicality, social impact). Social impact is evaluated through case analyses considering economic and political contexts.

Design at least two interactive formative assessments (feedback sessions, peer reviews, role-plays) to engage learners, incorporating activities reflecting cultural diversity and political communication skills.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
